# (PART) Group Examples {-}

# Cyclic Groups

```{r,echo=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
require(pracma)
CyclicCayley <- function(n,op="+") {
  G = 0:(n-1)
  T = mod(outer(G,G,op),n)
  rownames(T) = G
  colnames(T) = G
  return(T) }
```

## Overview

The finite **cyclic** group $\ZZ_{n} = \{ 0, 1, 2, \ldots, n-1\}$ is the group under addition mod $n$. For example, here is the Cayley table of $\ZZ_{10}$. See [Modular Arithmetic] for the R function that produces these tables for any value of $n$.


```{r,echo=TRUE}
CyclicCayley(10)
```
